Test of Time Award -- I just recently replayed this, nearly 12 years since it was unveiled, and it's still fantastic!

[h1]Wake up, mister Freeman...[/h1]
About 12 years ago I played Half-Life 1 for the first time. The story about a scientist who had to survive and save the humanity from the aliens in fact drew me into FPS genre in the first place.
For some time I forgot about Half-Life and I didn't get to play the second part.

Finally 4 years ago I got to this game and I played through this masterpiece completely.
Success of the predecessor was repeated in HL2. Highly esteemed gameplay features of HL1 were recreated and complemented with groundbreaking story and new previosly unseen features, making a revolution in the game industry once again. Story is truly fascinating and intriguing, even in 2020, it naturally continues after previous part shedding some light on the story in between two parts. Due to Source engine, a new word in the game graphics at that time, it looks rock solid even now. 


[i]Nothing to add but 
10/10[/i]

This game is amazing, everything about it from the epic story to the vast waistlands. From the moment I started the game I was hit with a huge wave of nastalgia. It's also reletivly cheap comepared to most games released today. For example Star Wars Battlefront cost $60 for half the game and another $60 for the DLCs and microtransactions, But this game only cost $10 for the whole game!!!
 

While that's all good, then again the game hasn't had a sequel since 2007. C'mon valve. Anyways It's probably my favourite game so far, unless Half Life 3 changes my mind. (Which I know it will.)   :D

A game that for it's time was revolutionary, yet remains a benchmark for single player first person campaigns. Its mark can be seen in almost all modern era shooters to this day. If you haven't given this game a spin then you'll most definitely be in for a fun ride, and if you haven't played it in a while why not boot it for ol' times sake.

It has Plot, segmented chapters, characters I care about, action, comedy, graphics look good, and makes me forget about the time as i play it. If you are lookin for another game to really stay in your mind as one of the greatest then look no further this is Half-Life 2.

Half-Life 2 is so universally known by this point, its almost pointless to review it by now. Here I go anyway. Half-Life 2 would probably be horrible by today's standards, but in 2004 it was amazing. Beautiful graphics all-around, particularly the NPC models. It featured a highly influental game engine, Source, which has gone on to power games like Left 4 Dead 2, Team Fortress 2, Portal 2, and Counter-Strike: Global Offensive. It has also stayed at the top of the most highly rated PC games list on Metacritic for more than 12 years. That means that for over a decade and thousands of game releases, not one has truly surpassed Half-Life 2 in quality. Finally, a sequal would be nice.

- Нашел хитрый способ прохождения, а он основной

- Ты решил схитрить и умер

Легенда, что тут ещё можно сказать про игру, которая до сих пор будоражит умы и ожидания при упоминании компании Valve и цифры три? Каждый хоть что-то да слышал про неё, есть множество модификаций - что уже говорить про хорошее отношение людей к данной игре, а значит есть за что! Считаю самой выдающейся игрой в своей эпохе.
Still one of the best sequels from one of the best Games ever! You have to play it!!! Videogame History! <3

Nominated this one for the "TEST OF TIME" steam award and not without reason. With it being one of my favourite games I can tell that even after 12 years (about 2/3 of my life at this moment) it still feels as fresh at the first day.
Also, reviewing a nominated game gets me an award, so that's cool I guess.

This is the only game that was made over a decade ago and can still feel like a brand-new title everytime you play it. With it's graphics being able to compete with many other modern titles to this day, it's physics-based puzzles that inspired the legendary Portal series, it's mix of FPS and an immersive story that mixes perfectly, the intense gameplay as you fight a wide vareity of foes, from zombies, antlions, to elite Combine troops. Although this game is over 10 years old, many still hail this title as the greatest PC game of all-time, and I'm inclined to agree.

Coup simulator 2004 is fun, you get to make your way across Eastern Europe shooting people and zombies, and meet interesting characters and take part in blowing more stuff up. Overall, I rate the game 4 CoD 4 Explosive Perks out of 5.

Half-Life 2 is an excellent successor to a marvellous game. Not only are the story, lore, and characters some of the best, (if not the best) of all time, it also manages to blend an action based first person shooter with superb physics-based puzzles.
